text: Have you noticed a difference between how HubSpot measures sessions and google analitycs? I have 20-30% more sessions recorded in HubSpot than GA. :thinking:

I've got this explanation from HS support AI, anything more to add to this?

```HubSpot measures a session by the referral domain that brings a visitor to your site, whereas Google Analytics measures a session based on the referral source/medium.
HubSpot segments metrics differently from Google Analytics, with discrepancies in how sources and channel groupings are handled.
In HubSpot, a new session is created if the source of a visitor's session changes due to interactions like ads, CTAs, or links in emails. This differs from Google Analytics.
Sessions in HubSpot include a series of visitor activities like page views, CTA clicks, and events, expiring after 30 minutes of inactivity. New sessions begin with a return after 30 minutes of inactivity or from a new session campaign.
Google Analytics counts a session when someone reaches your site from a referring source within a given time frame, with a session ending after a period of inactivity, not restarting at midnight.
The discrepancy in session numbers between HubSpot and Google Analytics is expected due to these differences in how sessions are defined and tracked in each platform.```

Hey <@UF6M5BW4C> there's no notification unfortunately. There is however an "Approval" functionality but you need Enterprise.

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

I am attempting to use `/crm/v3/associations/{fromObjectType}/{toObjectType}/batch/read` to retrieve all company associations from a contact, but it's only returning the primary. Am I missing something in the documentation to show all associations?
